Write a very short and concise review based on this: If you decide to eat here, just be aware it is going to take about 2 hours from beginning to end. We have tried it multiple times, because I want to like it! I have been to it's other locations in NJ and never had a bad experience. 

The food is good, but it takes a very long time to come out. The waitstaff is very young, but usually pleasant. We have just had too many experiences where we spent way too long waiting. We usually opt for another diner or restaurant on the weekends, in order to be done quicker. 

I think they need to re-evaluate their service and speed. It's a shame because the food is good, but it's just too slow.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: I've taken a lot of spin classes over the years, and nothing compares to the classes at Body Cycle. From the nice, clean space and amazing bikes, to the welcoming and motivating instructors, every class is a top notch work out.

For anyone who struggles to fit workouts in, the online scheduling system makes it easy to plan ahead (and there's no need to line up way in advanced like many gyms make you do).

There is no way I can write this review without giving Russell, the owner of Body Cycle, a shout out. Russell's passion for fitness and cycling is so evident, as is his desire for all of his clients to succeed. He is always dropping in to classes to check in/provide encouragement, and is open to ideas and recommendations from anyone. Russell always wears a smile on his face, even when he's kicking your butt in class!

Overall, I highly recommend Body Cycle to anyone looking for a top notch spin class experience.

What sets Body Cycle apart is their user-friendly online scheduling system, which simplifies planning ahead without the hassle of lining up excessively in advance, a common predicament at many gyms.

It is impossible to write this review without acknowledging Russell, the owner of Body Cycle. Russell's unwavering devotion to fitness and cycling is palpable, as is his genuine desire for his clients to succeed. He consistently pops into classes to offer support and encouragement, and he warmly welcomes ideas and suggestions from anyone. Russell, sporting an ever-present smile, commands every class, ensuring a challenging yet satisfying experience.

Overall, I wholeheartedly recommend Body Cycle to anyone seeking an exceptional spin class journey.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Cute interior and owner (?) gave us tour of upcoming patio/rooftop area which will be great on beautiful days like today. Cheese curds were very good and very filling. Really like that sandwiches come w salad, esp after eating too many curds! Had the onion, gruyere, tomato sandwich. Wasn't too much cheese which I liked. Needed something else...pepper jelly maybe. Would like to see more menu options added such as salads w fun cheeses. Lots of beer and wine as well as limited cocktails. Next time I will try one of the draft wines.
What would you write in your review?
Revise this with your best effort: I had a delightful experience at this place! The interior was undeniably charming, and the owner was kind enough to give us a tour of the upcoming patio/rooftop area. It will undoubtedly be a fantastic spot on beautiful days like the one we had. The cheese curds were absolutely delicious and quite satisfying. I particularly appreciated that the sandwiches were served with a salad, which helped balance out the indulgence of the curds. I opted for the onion, gruyere, and tomato sandwich, and it had just the right amount of cheese for my liking. However, I did feel like it needed a little something extra, like perhaps some pepper jelly. It would be wonderful if they added more menu options, like salads with fun cheeses. While the establishment had an extensive selection of beer and wine, the variety of cocktails was somewhat limited. I plan to return and try one of their draft wines on my next visit. Overall, it was a great experience, and I'm looking forward to returning for more delicious offerings and a lovely atmosphere.

The owner kindly gave us a tour of the upcoming patio/rooftop area, which will undoubtedly be perfect for beautiful days like today. The cheese curds were absolutely delightful and left me feeling pleasantly satisfied. I appreciated that the sandwiches were served with a refreshing salad, especially after indulging in the delicious curds. The onion, gruyere, and tomato sandwich had the perfect balance of cheese, and I found myself craving a touch of pepper jelly to elevate the flavors even more. It would be wonderful to see additional menu options like salads with fun cheeses. The wide variety of beer and wine, along with a few cocktail choices, created a nice selection. I'm looking forward to my next visit, where I plan to try one of the draft wines.

input: Write a very short and concise review based on this: Loved this tour! I grabbed a groupon and the price was great. It was the perfect way to explore New Orleans for someone who'd never been there before and didn't know a lot about the history of the city. Our tour guide had tons of interesting tidbits about the city, and I really enjoyed the experience. Highly recommended tour. I actually thought we were just going to tour through the cemetery, but she took us around the French Quarter for the first hour, and the cemetery for the second half of the tour. You'll meet up in front of a grocery store (seems strange at first, but it's not terribly hard to find, and it'll give you a chance to get some water), and you'll stop at a visitor center part way through the tour for a bathroom break if needed. This tour was one of my favorite parts of my trip!

It was the perfect way to experience New Orleans for a first-timer like me who had limited knowledge of the city's history. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and shared fascinating facts about the city throughout the whole tour. I highly recommend this tour. I initially expected to only visit the cemetery, but the guide surprised us by taking us through the French Quarter for the first hour, and then to the cemetery for the second half. Meeting in front of a grocery store might seem odd, but it's easy to find and gives you a chance to grab some water. Plus, there is a bathroom break at the visitor center during the tour if needed. Honestly, this tour was one of the highlights of my trip!

Additionally, there's a convenient bathroom break at a visitor center during the tour. This experience was one of the highlights of my trip!"

I would wish the staff would also clean or get rid of the dead grass that's also living by the water. The water is really green and dirty. Los padres national forest staff need to work hard to maintain this forest looking pretty and not like a dumpster. Even Cachuma lake looks like they put a bit more effort.
What would you write in your review?

I would write:
This Easter, instead of visiting Lopez Lake, we opted for a trip to Los Padres National Forest. While the scenery was indeed beautiful, we were disappointed to find that the staff at White Rock needs to address the overgrown grass and dirty water. It's unfortunate that the forest doesn't seem to be well-maintained, especially compared to other nearby lakes like Cachuma.

Our waitress brought our separate sushi orders on one plate so we couldn't really tell who's was who's and forgot several items on an order. I understand making mistakes but the restaraunt was really quiet so we were kind of surprised. Usually hibachi is a fun lively experience and our  cook  said maybe three words, but he cooked very well his name was Francisco. Service was fishy, food was pretty good, and im hoping it was just an off night here. But for the money I wouldn't go back.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: My experience with Shalimar was nothing but wonderful. 
I wanted to get my engagement ring sized and was told over the phone that it could probably be done within the day. 
When I brought it by, the team confirmed that the jeweler would be able to accommodate my same-day request and that it would be around $40 (simple band, decrease by three full sizes).
I checked my size one more time, confirmed, and left to let them do their thing.
When I came to pick up later that afternoon, the ring was too small. It's very important to note that Shalimar sized the ring perfectly, but that I made a mistake and should've gone up a half-size.
The Shalimar group were completely understanding and accommodating, even resizing my ring back up and getting it back to me within an hour at no charge! Even though it was my mistake!
The associates' attitudes in dealing with what was a pretty embarrassing situation instantly earned my satisfaction and loyalty as a customer. Very grateful for such a wonderful experience.

I called to inquire about resizing my engagement ring and they assured me it could be done same-day for around $40. When I dropped it off, they confirmed it was possible and I left it in their hands. Unfortunately, I had actually made a mistake with the size and the ring turned out too small. However, the team at Shalimar were incredibly understanding and accommodating, promptly resizing the ring back up at no charge and returning it to me within an hour. Their exceptional customer service and handling of this embarrassing situation instantly won my loyalty. I am immensely grateful for such a fantastic experience.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: The bun makes the Sonoran Dog. It's like a snuggie for the pup. A first, it seems ridiculous and almost like it's going to be too much, exactly like everyone's favorite blanket with sleeves. Too much softness, too much smush, too indulgent.  Wrong. It's warm, soft, chewy, fragrant, and it succeeds where other famed Sonoran Dogs fail. 

The hot dog itself is flavorful, but I would prefer that it or the bacon have a little more bite or snap to better hold their own against the dominant mustard and onions. 

I'm with the masses on the carne asada caramelo. Excellent tortilla, salty, melty cheese, and great carne. 

Super cheap and you can drive through.
Revise this with your best effort:
Here's my attempt:

"The bun of the Sonoran Dog is akin to a cozy snuggie for the pup. At first glance, it may appear excessive and overly indulgent, much like our beloved sleeved blankets. However, it surprises with its warmth, softness, chewiness, and delightful aroma, surpassing other renowned Sonoran Dogs.

While the hot dog itself is flavorful, I personally wished for either the bacon or the hot dog to possess a bit more bite or snap, to better complement the dominant mustard and onions.

As for the carne asada caramelo, I fully agree with the general consensus. The tortilla is exceptional, the cheese is irresistibly gooey and salty, and the carne is of great quality.

On top of all this, the prices are incredibly affordable and the convenience of a drive-through option is an added bonus."

While the hot dog and bacon are flavorful, a bit more bite or snap would help them stand their ground against the bold mustard and onions.

I agree with the crowd on the carne asada caramelo. The tortilla is superb, the cheese is salty and gooey, and the carne is fantastic.

This place offers great value, with quick drive-through service."

input: Write a very short and concise review based on this: The hubby and I have been here on multiple occasions and we have loved every part of the meal, every single time. Everyone from the servers to the bartender is very knowledgable about the menu and was able to immediately recommend items I could eat as-is, substitute or delete to make something safe for this Celiac girl to eat. The wine and cocktail menus are spot on. The food divine.  My only wish is that they would have a gluten-free dessert, we've always had to go elsewhere for something sweet. But that is not a big deal and I still want to go here time and time again. 4.5 stars.
Revise this with your best effort: My husband and I have frequented this place numerous times, and we've consistently adored our dining experiences. The staff, from servers to bartenders, are extremely knowledgeable about the menu. They effortlessly suggested suitable options for me to enjoy as a Celiac, whether modifying or removing ingredients. The wine and cocktail selections are exceptional, perfectly complementing the divine cuisine. The sole downside is the absence of a gluten-free dessert, compelling us to seek sweets elsewhere. Nevertheless, this minor flaw doesn't deter us from wanting to revisit this establishment time and time again. Rating: 4.5 stars.
Help me polish this: "Absolutely love this place! My husband and I have visited multiple times and we're always blown away by the incredible food and outstanding service. The staff is impressively knowledgeable about the menu and readily accommodated my gluten-free needs, suggesting safe options or making adjustments. The wine and cocktail selection is spot on, and the overall dining experience is divine. My only tiny disappointment is the lack of gluten-free dessert, but that won't stop us from coming back again and again. Highly recommended - 4.5 stars!"

They are very accommodating for my Celiac needs, suggesting options I can enjoy without worry. The only downside is the lack of gluten-free desserts, but it's not a deal-breaker for us. Overall, it's worth going back again and again. Rating: 4.5 stars.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Upland is a brewery based out of Bloomington, Indiana that has become popular enough to open up a couple additional locations in central Indiana.  All of their beers are very good, and I am also a fan of their burgers and tenderloins.  Therefore, I was excited to try their pizza, but I don't think it ended up being on par with these other items.  My margherita pizza had a cracker-like crust and was pretty light overall.  The cheese was good, but none of the other toppings added much flavor.  There was no red sauce as is typical for a true margherita pizza.  My opinion is that Upland's pizza might serve as a nice appetizer for a group, but I'll be sticking with their burgers or tenderloins as my meal of choice on future visits.
What is your review of Upland's pizza?

They also mention that there was no red sauce, which is typical for a true margherita pizza. The reviewer concludes that Upland's pizza might be a good appetizer, but they will stick with their other menu items for their meal of choice.

input:
Write a very short and concise review based on this: I was really between 3 and 4 stars for this one. I LOVE the 96th street Naked Tchopstix so I was very excited to see this one which is closer to my house.
The vibe is totally different as this is geared more to take out although they do have a decent size dining area. You order at the counter and they deliver it.
My daughter and I tried the sushi bowl. You pick up a piece of paper and  select from a choice of proteins, vegetables, rice and toppings. I like the fact that it is on paper and you don't have to guess what things are or have to shout over the counter to tell the server what you want. The sushi bowl was good but not wonderful. The choices particularly of the vegetables seemed a little too limiting and I felt I had more rice than other food items. The sauces were tasty. My husband ordered the Maui roll which is my favorite roll at the 96th street location and this just was not up that standard. It was good but the quality and consistently was not as good as at 96th street. I would go back though and I think a lot of people would be happy with the sushi bowls. I do want to make a comment about the low reviews that people have given the place because of service. People - it is a sushi place - it isn't McDonalds- so it will be a bit slower. You are not going to order and get out of there in five minutes even though it is called express. As a healthy alternative to fast food in the area, it is worth the wait. Oh and try the bubble tea. I had the strawberry and it was quite yummy. Next time I am going to try the vanilla chai.
Revise this with your best effort:
I was torn between giving this place 3 or 4 stars. I'm a huge fan of the 96th street Naked Tchopstix, so I was excited to try this closer location. The ambiance is different, more focused on takeout, but they do have a decent dining area. You order at the counter and they bring it to you.

My daughter and I opted for the sushi bowl, where you pick your proteins, veggies, rice, and toppings using a convenient paper menu. I liked that everything was clearly listed and I didn't have to shout my order. The sushi bowl was good, but not outstanding. I found the vegetable choices to be limited and the ratio of rice to other ingredients seemed off. The sauces were tasty though.

My husband ordered the Maui roll, which is my favorite at the 96th street location. Sadly, it didn't meet the same standard. It was good, but not as high in quality and consistency. Despite this, I would still consider going back as the sushi bowls seem to please many customers.

I do want to address the negative reviews regarding the service. People need to understand that this is a sushi place, not McDonald's, so it may be a bit slower. You won't be in and out in five minutes, even with the name "express." As a healthier fast food alternative in the area, it's worth a little wait.

Lastly, I highly recommend trying the bubble tea. I had the strawberry flavor and it was quite delicious. Next time, I'm looking forward to trying the vanilla chai.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: We checked in around 2:30 pm.  Check-in was quick and easy with complimentary valet parking (always appreciated).  The Peppermill is huge and reminded us of the Caesars Palace in Las Vegas.  They have around eight restaurants on site offering almost any type of food you could want.  The casino area is huge, rivaling almost anything you could find in Las Vegas.  One thing we noticed is that many of the slot machines were noted as being penny machines, but when you actually started to play them you realized they had minimum bets of anywhere from 30 cents to $5.  Talk about false advertising!  We were in the Tuscany Tower on the 12th floor.  Our room had a nice view of the huge pool area.  Our room was large and featured free WiFi (likewise always appreciated), a huge bathroom area with large shower (with two shower heads), TV, a large jetted bathtub and a phone next to the commode.  There were dual sinks and lots of counter space.  Plenty of towels were supplied.  The roomy main area had a king bed with night stands, closet, TV, mini fridge, dresser with two drawers, a safe, table for computer or writing, complimentary bottles of water, and three nicely upholstered chairs and table.  The thermostat did a good job controlling the temperature and keeping it comfortable.  Staff were all courteous and helpful.  A very nice place and we enjoyed our stay.  We would definitely stay here again.
What is the reviewers overall opinion of the hotel?
The reviewer has a very positive opinion of the hotel. They mention that the check-in process was quick and easy, the hotel is huge and reminiscent of Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and they were impressed with the variety of restaurants on site. They also appreciated the free WiFi and the large, well-appointed room. While they noted that some of the slot machines had higher minimum bets than expected, they were overall very satisfied with their stay and would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: The only reason I didn't give this restaurant a 5 star rating, is because of one single pretentious waiter. As a 4 night guest at Hotel Palomar, the location of the restaurant is an obvious plus. The first night of my stay, I met a coworker in the restaurant for a cocktail. When we arrived, the host staff were busy and not available, so we just walked in. The restaurant was not too busy, so we just looked at a small table next to the bar and proceeded to take a seat. A waiter came by and I quickly asked if we could have a seat, before sitting down and told him we'd only be having cocktails. He stumbled on his reply, and in an irritated/in-convinced tone, told me "I guess it would be fine" and basically just kept walking mid sentence. My guest and I brushed it off, and started having a conversation while looking at the drink menu. To make a long story short, he was distant and we both got the "couldn't be bothered" vibe from him. When it came to the bill, we asked if it could be split due to company transaction policies, and you would have thought asked him for some inconceivable task. We basically spent the rest of our night and elevator ride to our room in shock of the rudeness we had just experienced. 

Although that situation left a bad taste in our mouth, and the night before we decided to avoid the restaurant, we decided to grab another cocktail and give this place one more try. After looking around and ensuring "last nights waiter" wasn't on shift, we walked over to the bar and started looking over the menu. Instantly, the bartender greeted us with pleasant small talk and made us feel 100% welcome. He asked about our day, recommended cocktails and was a completely genuine person. This guy (I think his name was Ben) is an absolute star! He gave us lessons on Whiskey, described how to make classic cocktails, and was 100% invested in our experience. This is exactly what a bartender at a 4/5 star establishment should be - actually he exceeds that. He was kind, funny, friendly and completely redeemed this restaurant/bar from our terrible experience the night before. 
I also ordered room service last night from this restaurant, and it was amazing. The bacon wrapped dates and chocolate cake are to die for! Great restaurant and amazing bartender(s). Too bad one bad egg could have spoiled this experience.
Revise this with your best effort:
Although my overall experience at this restaurant was tainted by one pretentious waiter, I must say that the location at Hotel Palomar is a definite plus. During my stay, I decided to meet a coworker for a cocktail in the restaurant. Unfortunately, the host staff was unavailable, so we took it upon ourselves to find a seat. The waiter we encountered seemed disinterested and gave off an annoyed vibe when we asked for a table. However, we brushed it off and proceeded with our conversation. As the night went on, his distant and unengaged attitude persisted, leaving us shocked and disappointed. 

Despite this negative encounter, we decided to give the restaurant another chance the following night. We made sure to confirm that the previous waiter was not working, and we were pleasantly surprised by the bartender's warm and genuine welcome. This bartender, who I believe was named Ben, exceeded all expectations. He engaged in friendly conversation, recommended cocktails, and even provided us with whiskey lessons. His kindness, humor, and dedication to our experience redeemed the restaurant and bar from the previous night's unpleasantness. 

I also had the opportunity to order room service from this restaurant, and I was blown away by the quality. The bacon wrapped dates and chocolate cake were absolutely divine. Overall, this restaurant has great potential, thanks to the amazing bartender(s). It's unfortunate that one bad apple could have potentially ruined the entire experience.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: NEVER AGAIN. This is a so called restaurant that does nothing that a restaurant should other than prepare food, because the rest is done by the patron. Want water? Get up and go across the yard to get it. Want a drink, walk up a flight of stairs and pay cash. Want to sit in a dirty yard in dirty lawn chairs, enjoy yourself. The wait staff is mildy helpful in that they bring you your food after you go to the window and pay cash for it...kind of like New Orleans Hamburger and Seafood, but dirty and with live music (which is nice). It's a one in a lifetime experience for me...just once.

input:
Write a very short and concise review based on this: If you want to pay for everything a la carte this is the place for you.  
Food wasn't terrible not impressive.
They brought a basket of chips and some tomato sauce which I asked politely for something spicier and some pico de gallo.  She brought them happily to me and the salsa was much better.  When asked what we would like to drink I asked for a coke and she brought out a bottle which I stated I wanted the fountain drink.  She said "oh that's only Pepsi".  Never mentioned that they only had bottle drinks for coke.  
We ordered our food which was reasonably priced, asked for sour cream and also to put cheese on the taco.  She let us know cheese was extra.  
It was $2.50 extra for another basket of chips.  
When I received the bill we paid more for the condiments then the actual food.  Side of sour cream 2.00, pico de gallo 2.50, salsa 2.00, chips 2.50, cheese 1.00 and the bottled coke that we didn't want 5.00.  
Just a suggestion...when you order anything make sure to ask if there is an extra charge.  
Overall not a bad place to eat but not worth the price.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: On a scale of one to things that are awesome, this place is the bomb. 

I was drawn in by the promise of the duckfat frenchfries. Took the boy for his birthday and put our name in, had a drink around the corner while we waited and were given seats at the bar after about 45 minutes. 

We were waited on by Keith, the bartender, who was congenial, knowledgeable about his whiskeys and an all-around cool guy. We started with 3 cape may salts (two for me, one for the boy) and tater tots, both of which made me happy.

For dinner, I got Kentucky Fried Quail (stellar, though the succotash was not as exciting as I wanted it to be) and the boy got the 24$ Fois Gras burger, which was incredible. Worth every penny. The duckfat fries were pretty yummy, but not even the best part of the meal. I could've done without the cheese sauce, but as it was on the side I wasn't deterred.

I look forward to coming back here, with everyone I know.

My Kentucky Fried Quail was outstanding, although the succotash fell short of my expectations. The $24 Fois Gras burger that my son ordered was absolutely incredible and worth every penny. The duckfat fries were tasty, but not the standout of the meal. I would have preferred the cheese sauce on the side, but it didn't dampen my experience. I can't wait to return here with all my friends and family.

input: Write a very short and concise review based on this: It was my fiance's birthday and he decided he wanted a good, laid back Thai restaurant for dinner. Yelp steered us in the Jasmine Rice direction, and it was definitely a good decision. We wanted the summer rolls, which were on the menu, but apparently will not be available until summer, so we settled on the pan-fried dumplings. The flavor was good, but I don't think we'd order them again. We got the green curry fried rice with duck and chicken pad thai. Both of those dishes were great, but the duck stole the show. That was some the of tastiest duck I've ever had. The pad thai was a bit sweet for us, so I think we'd try a different noodle dish when we return. But it was still very good, especially with some chili sauce mixed in. Our service was good, but other people had issues. One table was rushing to get to a show at the Kimmel Center and waited quite a while for their meal (and were going to be late). Another person who got take-out was missing one of their items (but the owner realized it and called him and walked the dish to his house, which was very nice). Overall, good quality Thai! We would definitely go back.
Revise this with your best effort: For my fiancé's birthday, we wanted a relaxed Thai restaurant and found Jasmine Rice through Yelp. It was a great choice. Although we couldn't have the summer rolls, the pan-fried dumplings were decent but not something we'd order again. The green curry fried rice with duck and chicken pad thai were both fantastic, but the duck stole the spotlight with its incredible flavor. The pad thai was a bit sweet for our taste, so we'd opt for a different noodle dish next time. However, it was still delicious, especially when mixed with some chili sauce. Our service was good, although some customers faced issues. One table, in a rush to attend a show at the Kimmel Center, had to wait quite a while for their meal and risk being late. Another customer who ordered take-out was missing an item, but the owner personally delivered it to their home, which was a nice gesture. Overall, Jasmine Rice offers high-quality Thai cuisine, and we would definitely return.

The service was good, but some customers encountered delays. Despite that, the owner went above and beyond by personally delivering a missing item to a take-out customer. Overall, it's a quality Thai restaurant that we would definitely return to.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: I love the Brewpub for their variety of dishes.  Nachos, pizza and sandwiches.  Variety of beers to choose from crafted right on sight.  

Every time we go, the service is slow.  I think it's just the pace of the restaurant.  It's never a quick beer and a bite of food.  Instead, enjoy the patio and friends, savor that time.  

Kid and dog friendly environment.  Also great for your vegetarian and vegan friends.  

My go to is a half order of the nachos or fish & chips.  

Tried their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer and it's on par with some of my favorite pumpkins.  Great flavor and aroma. 

Overall, a great spot for a casual night out with friends and family.  Just be prepared to spend some time there.

The service might be on the slower side, but it allows you to fully enjoy the relaxed atmosphere and spend quality time with your loved ones on the patio. This establishment welcomes kids, dogs, as well as vegetarian and vegan patrons. Personally, I recommend trying the half order of nachos or the fish & chips. Moreover, their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer is a delightful treat with a fantastic flavor and aroma, comparable to some of the best pumpkins I've had. Ultimately, the Brewpub is a splendid choice for a laid-back evening with friends and family, although be prepared to linger a while.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: My go to menu is coconut soup and pad thai with protein. I tried same menu here. 
Actually really like their coconut soup. They used enough amount of coconut milk that soup was really creamy and wasn't over powering with herb. I am so used to Americanized thai cuisine that I prefer less herb on my dish except cilantro.
Pat thai was great too. Liked the amount of peanut they used, noodle was chewy and perfect and not too sweet. They gave me generous amount of chicken and white meat wasn't dry so I was very happy with my meal. 
Overall I would definitely come back here and recommend it to my friends.
Revise this with your best effort:
Here's my best effort at revising the review:

"My go-to menu is always coconut soup and pad thai with protein. I decided to try the same menu at this place and was pleasantly surprised. The coconut soup was fantastic – they used just the right amount of coconut milk, resulting in a creamy texture that wasn't overpowering with herbs. As someone accustomed to Americanized Thai cuisine, I prefer less herb in my dishes, except for cilantro. 

The pad thai was also delicious. I loved the generous amount of peanuts used, and the noodles were perfectly chewy without being too sweet. The chicken portion was quite generous, and the white meat was moist and flavorful. Overall, I was extremely satisfied with my meal and would definitely return here. I highly recommend it to my friends."

The pad Thai was also fantastic. The peanut flavor was well-balanced, the noodles were chewy and cooked perfectly, and it wasn't overly sweet. They were also quite generous with the chicken, and the white meat wasn't dry at all, which made me very happy with my meal.

Overall, I would definitely come back to this place and wholeheartedly recommend it to my friends."

Write a very short and concise review based on this: We were a bit weary about trying the Shellfish Company on the Wharf as more often than not, many places like these (see Cannery Row, Monterey) feast on a captive audience and provide sub-standard fare at high prices.

However, emboldened by the perennial good reviews on Yelp, we suppressed our initial observations and went ahead with the trying it out. The place is small, so definitely plan ahead. You will have to wait, so either you know, just do so, or perhaps try to visit outside of peak hours. Luckily, our wait was only about 20 minutes as the dinner rush was just leveling off.

The special was the local rock crab - $25 for 3 lbs of California Rock Crab, salad, and your choice of soup/chowder. After taking a look at a few trays of rock crab being served out, the wife and I both opted for it, as it looked awesome.  

The salad/chowder combo was great as you actually received hearty portions of each, so it was a good start. As much as I liked the chowder however, the Shrimp Bisque the wife ordered was amazing, so I would recommend that going forward. 

But enough of prattling on about side dishes: the rock crab tasted just as glorious as it looked. Juicy, buttery chunks of white crab meat await you, just a few cracks away. While the rock crab shells are pretty thick, once cracked, they splinter and separate easily, a good sign they are cooked to perfection. The rock crabs provided a great amount of meat for what I felt to be the least amount of work you're going to do for crab, King or otherwise. 

We were thoroughly satisfied with our meal and along with the special being an overall great value, devouring the Rock Crab at SBSC turned out to be one of the favorite meals on the trip. I think ordering crab here is a safe proposition indeed. 4 stars.

The salad and chowder were generous portions and a good start to the meal. While I enjoyed the chowder, my wife's Shrimp Bisque was exceptional and highly recommended.

Now, let's talk about the star of the show: the rock crab. It tasted just as delightful as it looked. The meat was juicy, buttery, and easily accessible with a few cracks. input:
Write a very short and concise review based on this: I LOVE Weaver's Way and really disagree with some of the content in previous reviews. WW is not necessarily meant for convenience shopping. I am a single woman and I find that I have no trouble shopping at the co-op, during peak times or otherwise. I actually find the co-op to be a great place to shop if you live alone because I can get smaller quantities of items than if I shop at the corporate stores like Acme. I also enjoy the work hours - I've worked throughout the store, but most recently, I have been getting in my hours by participating in the membership committee. I wouldn't say that the community is necessarily made up of "tree huggers" and "earth children", though. The community is made up of a variety of similarly-minded folks from different backgrounds. I enjoy having a place to go to where I can obtain locally grown produce, a place that offers more natural, wholesome, and preservative-free foods than chain stores with prices way below that of Whole Foods. I enjoy interacting with other members and contributing to my local and global community. I don't find the membership fee or the work hours to be prohibitive being a single person vs. a family. I don't think that membership in a co-op is for everyone and, if you aren't single, it's definitely not a solo decision. If you're keen on being committed to the Weaver Way values, you couldn't find a better place to shop. If not, stick to the chain stores or just pay the 10% visitors' fee to pop in once in a while.

The flexible work hours are great too – I've worked various roles and currently enjoy contributing to the membership committee. Contrary to common assumptions, the community isn't solely composed of "tree huggers" or "earth children," but rather diverse individuals with similar values. I appreciate having a destination for locally grown produce and a wide selection of natural, wholesome, and preservative-free foods priced below Whole Foods. Engaging with other members and supporting local and global causes is fulfilling. As a single person, I don't find the membership fee or work hours burdensome – although joining a co-op might not suit everyone, especially without considering the preferences of a family. If you're committed to Weaver's Way values, this is undeniably the best shopping destination. Otherwise, sticking to chain stores or occasionally paying the 10% visitors' fee may suffice.

I would rate this review a solid 4.5 out of 5.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: After living in the STL area for way over 10 years now, I am both ashamed and remorseful to admit that I ate here for the FIRST time just a few weeks ago. I am ashamed because it's a St. Louis tradition and remorseful because I missed out on it for so..many...years! 

This place is amazing. What is not to love! It's a factory where you can get a tour (Friday-Sunday, noon-5pm on the hour), there's a shop, bar, and dining area. They also host many event with live music on the weekends. It's fun to just kind of wander and look around - don't worry, you'll get a chance because there will likely be a wait before you dine. The beer is, of course, amazing. The Hefeweizen is my personal favorite and a great start for anyone who is not a huge beer drinker (like myself). Additionally, the food is homegrown and damn good. I had the pizza (recommendation from my server) and it was really spectacular, though I'm admittedly a pizza connoisseur so I enjoy a good pizza pie more than most probably ;P My date had a bison burger which was also really good. 

More fun info: the service is great! I think they tend to hire more funky and alternative people (like tattoo parlor staff) which I support. The quality is what makes this place stand out along with the emphasis on local food and brewery. 

It is a little on the pricier side but for all the experience you get and the quality, it is worth it. I will go again and again and you probably should, too!

They even host events with live music. The beer is outstanding, with the Hefeweizen being my personal favorite. And for those who aren't big beer drinkers, it's a great place to start. The food is locally sourced and delicious. I highly recommend their pizza, but the bison burger is also top-notch. The service is excellent, and the staff's unique and alternative vibe adds to the experience. While it may be a bit pricey, the quality and overall experience make it well worth it. I'll definitely be coming back again and again, and I highly encourage you to check it out too!

Write a very short and concise review based on this: My food only merited maybe two stars but I will give an extra star because I like the menu (and will try more of it) and their design and concept.  Sadly though, my tomato-basil soup tasted kind of like a weak marinara and my tuna melt type sandwich had a very sharp, off-putting flavor.  It was citrusy, for sure, and I love lemon in a tuna melt but perhaps this was lemon zest or something just way too overpowering?  I think next time I will focus on the dishes with cured Italian meats, mortadella and prosciutto.  And also the baked goods, those sounded pretty good, especially the Nutella bruschetta!  I will definitely give this place another try, but I think they need to work on their flavors a bit.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: A couple friends and I stopped by for some late night milkshakes and found ourselves at More Than Just Ice Cream. Well, we just got ice cream...not fully taking advantage of what the name implies, but maybe next time.

3 milkshakes: 1 coffee, 1 chocolate, and 1 black&white malt. 

All were pretty good. Definitely satisfied the ice cream craving. I thought my coffee milkshake could have been thicker, same goes for the chocolate. The black&white was plenty thick and was probably the best of the three. Unfortunately, I did not order that one so I settled for my not so creamy coffee.

I did sample some ice cream flavors before setting on a milkshake. I tried the pumpkin pie which was AMAZING. I don't know why I didn't just get this. Maybe a milkshake isn't the way to go here.

Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick ice cream fix. Just don't expect too much from the milkshakes.

Before settling on a shake, I sampled the pumpkin pie ice cream and it was amazing. I should've just gotten that. Overall, this place is recommended for a quick ice cream fix, but don't expect exceptional milkshakes.

input:
Write a very short and concise review based on this: I visited this restaurant 4 times during my 5 days stay. Crazy, right? Here are a list of reasons/pros:

- We were staying a nearby hotel.
- The restaurant opens 11 - 10:30 pretty much every day including new year's day so it fits into our schedule.
- If you are a party of two, chances are you get seated right away.
- $9 per dozen of oysters which is a really great deal by any standard!
- They have a seafood shop next door that sells boiled and fresh seafood to- go.
- Our server (same) is very friendly and recognized us every single time.

Now I want to talk about the reasons why I only give it 3 stars.

- We tried a bunch of stuff which are all pretty mediocre. Raw oysters are not cleaned well. So if your schedule is flexible, go to Superior Seafood during their happy hours for their 50 cents/oyster - better quality and cheaper. Turtle soup has a strange taste so I definitely prefer Felix's. A portion of my boiled shrimps are always mushy somhow, maybe boiled for too long?...
- The ambient is inviting but not comfortable so we basically just finished our food and go. 
- Clean the bathroom!!

Will probably visit again if we stay in the area next time or simply just pick up some seafood quickly.

What do you think?
Revise this with your best effort:
During my five-day stay in the area, I visited this restaurant four times. It may seem crazy, but here are the pros:

1. The restaurant's convenient location near our hotel made it easily accessible.
2. Opening from 11 AM to 10:30 PM, including New Year's Day, ensured it fit perfectly into our schedule.
3. Parties of two were promptly seated without any delay.
4. The price of $9 per dozen of oysters was an exceptional deal.
5. The adjacent seafood shop sold delicious boiled and fresh seafood to-go.
6. Our server, who recognized us each time, was incredibly friendly.

However, a few reasons contribute to my three-star rating:

1. The various dishes we tried were mediocre; the raw oysters were not properly cleaned. Superior Seafood offers better quality oysters for just 50 cents during happy hours.
2. The ambiance was inviting but lacked comfort. Consequently, we usually finished our food quickly and left.
3. The bathroom needs proper cleaning.

Overall, I would consider returning if I stay in the area again or simply for a quick seafood pickup. What are your thoughts?

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Meh is all I can say for TDS. The restaurant itself is just cold.... not literally, but figuratively. There was no decor, no menu boards, stainless steel prep tables as dining tables, no soda machines, staff EVERYWHERE with no identification (shirts, nametags, etc). The food is reasonably priced and most of it was quite good, but what really irked my party was the fact that they charge for extra salsa!!! We ordered a salsa trio (which included 3 samples of the various salsas, in 2oz glass prep bowls), and when my brother asked for more salsa for his tacos (mind you, we ordered one of ever taco, three burritos and guacamole), he was told he'd have to buy the trio again! Really!!??? We spent over $40 on food, drinks and apps, too. Even though the food was decent, I wouldn't return as the atmosphere is just blah and you can't get extra salsa for your damn tacos! 😡

Despite spending over $40 on food and drinks, we were denied extra salsa without purchasing the trio again. This policy was extremely frustrating. The lackluster atmosphere and the refusal for extra salsa make me reluctant to return. I would rate this review 2 out of 5 stars.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Id you haven't been to the Smoothie King center since it was know as the New Orleans Arena, you are in for a nice surprise. The arena has had a face lift and, while the seats are the same,  everything else has been refreshed.   

Most importantly,  the food options are far more varied and appeal to many tastes.  The quality of the food is very good and significantly improved from a few years back. The drink options are much improved as well and include full service bars, spiked lemonade,  bottled and draft beer and of course, smoothies.  There is even a spot for sweets. You can get funnel cake, cotton candy, and all kinds of delicious things I was too full to take in.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Had to wait until my third trip to NOLA to actually get in the door.  First two times I tried waiting in line, this time around we got smart and bought reserved seats so we could be on the benches. Well worth the extra $20 to not hassle with waiting in line for an hour. It goes toward the preservation of Jazz so it's a good cause...just splurge.

The show was fantastic.  True musicians and great personalities to boot. I can only imagine that this is what concerts were like 50 years ago. The band members were dapper, engaging and insanely talented.  It's in a tiny hole in the wall space that only holds maybe 200 people? So it's very intimate and nice to see the smiles on the faces of the musicians as they share their craft with you. This is a must do while in NOLA!

The band members were stylish, engaging, and incredibly skilled. The small venue, with a capacity of around 200 people, created an intimate atmosphere where you can appreciate the musicians' smiles as they passionately shared their craft. If you find yourself in NOLA, this is an absolute must-do experience!

input: Write a very short and concise review based on this: A GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!!!!!!!  I was a completely new customer.  I did not have an appointment because my other plans got rained out and my dealership was too busy to take me.  I needed a PA State & Emissions  inspection which I dread because they can be a total ripoff at some places when they add things on and I just wanted to get it over with.  I saw that this place had much better reviews on Yelp than many other shops in the area.  Keystone Discount Tire took my 2008 Pontiac Torrent in for inspection while I waited and had some free coffee.  I only had to get up once to look at some irregular outer front tire wear on my car when it was on the rack during inspection.  I always appreciate it when the technician lets me look at the problem.   It was nothing major.  Easily correctable with an alignment sometime in the future.  Bill was very friendly, knowledgable, and straightforward with his overall analysis of my car.  My car was fully inspected and stickered in less than an hour without my bill being jacked up with add-ons.   I recommend getting on their mailing list for their coupons!!!!!!!!!!  I will definitely be back for my next oil change and other maintenance needs.  I will also recommend this place to my friends and family.  I am so glad I found this place.  I will never go back to my old dealership again.  They are too expensive and not as good as this place.  I will be a loyal customer from now on.  Thank you Keystone Discount Tire for a great experience.  I will be back.  I will also recommend you to my friends and family.  You guys are awesome.  I will never go anywhere else. Write a very short and concise review based on this: I have been to a number of dog friendly hotels...just not in the city and did not know what to expect. Usually they are motel like.  This one was in the heart of the city.

I walked tentatively into the hotel lobby as i have a labrador/golden mix who is not easy to hide.

We got to the front desk to register and i was still feeling uneasy although my  bf had assured me it was a dog friendly hotel. Reception was so nice immediately putting us at ease. As we checked in an attendant asked if Bentley could have treats which she fullly enjoyed. The Reception person also asked if we would like a welcome kit for Bentley. Holy moly. Of course. Dog dishes, a mat, treats, etc. I was blown away.  

Plus the guests at the hotel all stopped to compliment and pet "queen Bentley". Our room was on the top floor. Awesome!

Even when i went to walk her the car attendants greeted her by name. We were so impressed with the service we decided to come back an extra night. 

Thank you Loews. I didnt realize a hotel could be so dog friendly especially to a big dog.
Revise this with your best effort: I have stayed at several dog-friendly hotels before, but they were usually located outside the city and had a more motel-like feel. However, this one, located in the heart of the city, exceeded my expectations. Initially, I felt unsure about bringing my Labrador/Golden mix, as she is quite noticeable. But the reception at the hotel immediately put my worries to rest. They were incredibly welcoming and even offered treats for my dog, Bentley. To my amazement, they also provided a welcome kit for her, complete with dog dishes, a mat, and treats. The other guests at the hotel were also very friendly towards Bentley, showering her with compliments and pets. Our room on the top floor was excellent. Even the car attendants greeted Bentley by name when we took her for a walk. The exceptional service left such an impression on us that we decided to extend our stay for an additional night. Loews, thank you for showing us that a hotel can be so accommodating to a big dog like Bentley.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Been to this location twice and will never go back again!!!!

First time was mediocre, the second time was so very disappointing it beggars belief. I ordered some ribs and had to send them back because one half was warm and the other half was refrigerator cold. They came back and one side was really hot and the other side was still cold, third time it was edible. The manager came over the third time to apologize, never once offered to comp anything. I'm not the kind of guy to cause a fuss to get something comped, but to send something back three times to get it cooked properly and only get an insincere apology really pisses me off, enough for me to write this review. I will never go back to this location again, it's a waste of time and money.

When they brought it back, one side was scorching hot while the other remained cold. Finally, on the third attempt, it was actually edible. The manager did apologize on the third try, but never offered any compensation. I'm not one to make a scene just to receive a freebie, but having to send back a dish three times for proper cooking and receiving nothing but a half-hearted apology really infuriates me. This location is a complete waste of both time and money - I will never set foot here again.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Looks like there is a second Red Kings restaurant in Chinatown and it did not disappoint! Since this place just opened yesterday, I'm not exactly sure if it's replacing the other Red Kings down the street, or if it is just a second helping of spicy, Szechuan food.

We ordered takeout and picked up the Dan Dan Noodles and a shredded Pork in Garlic sauce dish. The spice level in both dishes was perfect.  Extremely mouth-burning, but with delicious flavors that were sweet, earthy, and fresh. The portions were very generous and will make for great leftovers for us. I can't wait to try some of the other dishes and come back here for a sit-down dinner. They also have karaoke rooms upstairs, plus they are BYOB. 4.5 stars!

Despite just opening, I couldn't tell if it's replacing the other one or offering additional spicy Szechuan delights. The dishes had the perfect spice level, complemented by sweet, earthy, and fresh flavors. The portions were generous, leaving us with delightful leftovers. I am eager to explore their other offerings and return for a sit-down dinner. Excitingly, they provide karaoke rooms upstairs and allow BYOB. I rate them 4.5 stars!

We saw turtles and birds too! Our tour guide had a baby alligator we could hold that he's raising until it's a little bigger since it was a late hatch that would have died because of when it was born. Write a very short and concise review based on this: We stayed at The Saint last year for a girl's trip. The lobby is lovely, they have a cool bar and restaurant that you can't help but to "ohh and ahh" over when you walk in.  All the things I'm accustomed too when I stay at a hotel anywhere...ambiance, a little sexy but not overkill! Everyone is so friendly, etc.  I'm thinking "oh shhhh this is going to be a great weekend!"  I checked in a few hours before my girl arrived because I had a ton of work i needed to do. So I set up my laptop ordered some room service and worked for about 4 hours straight. Left out to buy a bottle and get a mani/pedi.  My girl arrives...its about to be some trouble in NOLA... the two of us and no supervision...we pop out for dinner, come back in giggling as usual and we see it...a HUGH flying roach.  I'm freaked out.  I literally walk right out of the room down to the front desk.  I CANNOT!!!! They tell me they're sending a maintenance worker to handle it.  NOT GOOD ENOUGH! If there's one that's bold enough to show itself, he has other cohorts that prefer to live behind the scenes. They give us another room but tell me they can't do more until 8am.  No the room the move us too also has small spiders and other dead small bugs in the corners of the window. The TV doesn't work and one of the lamps doesn't have bulbs in it! COME ON!  At this point its about 3am and I know I'm not staying here past 8:15am. I dont want to sit my purse let alone my luggage in this hotel! I go online to my normal go to hotel, The W and book us there for the rest of the trip! 8am comes and goes no manager comes to our room. I go down and demand to see someone immediately.  This younger gentlemen comes out and apologizes.  I thank him for his apology and politely request ALL of my money back immediately.   He obliged and asked if  I would consider coming back after changes have been made! Bless his heart. NO dear! I'm out of here!  I'm so glad I have my go to hotel to fall back on!  I will never stay here again!  I will make sure to tell all my friends and family to avoid this place at all costs!  I'm so done with this hotel!  I'm so done with the roaches and spiders and lack of customer service!  I'm so done with this place!  I'm out of here! 🚫👎🏼🕷️🐜💔"
This reviewer had a terrible experience at The Saint hotel, with a huge roach in their room and other issues such as small spiders, dead bugs, and a non-functional TV. They were not satisfied with the hotel's response and demanded a full refund, which they were given. The reviewer will never stay at The Saint again and warns others to avoid the hotel due to its poor conditions and lack of customer service.

I will never stay at The Saint again and strongly advise others to avoid it. The conditions and customer service were disappointing, and I am glad to have a reliable alternative.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: So disappointing on so many levels. Have been coming here for years - and the quality of food has fallen off a cliff. Strike one - we shared an artichoke to start - and clearly it had been prepared beforehand (eg, cold on the inside - but the flesh was cooked through)  Strike two - my wife had a Greek salad - and it clearly all came from a bag and was extremely overdressed with tasteless dressing.  Strike three - I had grilled yellowtail which was basically execrable - could not even finish it (overcooked and an inferior-frozen piece of fish - unacceptable for SB). 

In short - great setting, good service - but with such horrible food - not worth the visit. This place really needs to up the quality of food - or it's going to end up just another lower State dive for the tourists.

To make matters worse, my wife's Greek salad was clearly from a bag and drowned in a tasteless dressing. Write a very short and concise review based on this: Milktooth is the place to go if you want a good breakfast cocktail and a twist on traditional brunch. At first glance of the menu, you may think you've never heard of any of these foods for breakfast, and you may be right. I guarantee no matter what you order, you're going to enjoy it. 

Milktooth is one of the most popular brunch places in Indy, which means you will typically have a wait. Trust me, it's worth the usual 30 minute wait (on weekends). To make it go by a little faster, they've got a walk up bar for their coffee drinks and pastries. Snack on one of those to give you a preview of the amazing meal you're about to have.

Their menu changes from time to time but they have a few things that stay one the menu but change ingredients. I love all of their variations on a Dutch pancake, and their raclette grilled cheese is to die for.  If you're making this a boozy breakfast, don't pass up on the michelada. And sit outside if it's warm enough!

The menu may seem unfamiliar at first, but rest assured that every dish will leave you satisfied. Despite the typical wait time of 30 minutes, this popular Indy brunch spot is well worth it. To help pass the time, grab a delicious coffee drink or pastry from their walk up bar. While the menu occasionally changes, certain staples like the Dutch pancake variations and the mouthwatering raclette grilled cheese never disappoint. Don't miss out on the michelada if you're looking for a boozy breakfast, and if the weather permits, opt for outdoor seating.

And if the weather allows, be sure to sit outside.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Oh Chickie's and Pete's, you are the perfect place to watch some sports and indulge. 

No doubt this is not the best food I've ever had but, if you can get a seat, grab some beer with mussels red and crab fries, there's no way not to thoroughly enjoy this place during a game or any time you're down by the stadiums. 

My favs are the crab fries, mussels red (white is overloaded with garlic that I can't always take it), the spicy pull and peel shrimp, steamers, and if the mood is right the blue crabs (it's a lot of work but tasty). This place also makes getting down and dirty with your food easy. There are sinks all over so you can rinse the mess off your hands once you're done....good touch.

To sum it up, Chickie's and Pete's is a Philadelphia institution and always a good time. I strongly suggest going at least once to enjoy the experience. 

Please note: Make sure to remember two things before coming during major sporting events. 1. You'll never get a table and 2. You'll deal with a ton of drunk people. I've absolutely been one of these people before and we can get annoying unless you're in the right frame of mind. :)"

As for my favorites, nothing beats the delectable crab fries, mussels red (avoid the garlic-heavy white edition), tangy and spicy pull and peel shrimp, steamers, and, if the occasion calls for it, the labor-intensive yet delicious blue crabs. Moreover, the thoughtful addition of sinks throughout the establishment makes it effortless to clean up after digging into messy dishes.

In summary, Chickie's and Pete's is an iconic Philadelphia institution that never fails to deliver a good time. I highly recommend experiencing it at least once.

Please be aware: Remember two crucial aspects when attending major sporting events here. First, obtaining a table becomes nearly impossible, and second, the presence of heavily intoxicated individuals can be overwhelming. I confess to having been one of those people in the past, and we might become bothersome unless you're in the right mindset.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: I stopped in for a drink yesterday and have to say the atmosphere gets an A+ from me.  Such a unique concept for the St. Pete area.  The attention to detail with the remodel was outstanding, it almost feels like you are in a Harry Potter movie or something.  There is background music that is set at a low volume so you can clearly hear your friends or not have to shout for them to hear you - perfect for the old library-esque environment. Working behind the bar were Michael and Peggy - both couldn't have been more friendly and were overall just interesting people to talk to.   I had eaten dinner already before I came so can't speak on the food but will definitely be back to try - the prices for meat/cheese trays are much better than comparable places in the area.  I would definitely recommend checking this place out...

Write a very short and concise review based on this: It seems to me that whenever we have out of towner guests, our go to place is consistently Katie's. The variety of food wonderfully prepared is 2nd to none. Reasonably priced and delicious, Katie's never disappoints. Whether you choose the grilled ersters, the shrimp and grits, the Cuban sandwich, pizza, or soup & salad you will be very pleased and have a great meal. Daily specials hi-lite local seasonal offerings that keep things fresh. The service staff are warm and friendly. On Sunday's, you will want to time your arrival before church let's out or you will have a bit of a wait. That said, you can always manage while enjoying bottomless Mimosas!

Write a very short and concise review based on this: I'm giving this joint 4 stars because they have earned it, but they are definitely 5 star material, if they work out a few kinks. Granted, they just opened, so some of the errors I've experienced (I work in the area, so I've been there several times) will probably get worked out and they are more than willing to make corrections and accommodations when they mess up. 

But over all, the food is REALLY good. Unlike my fellow Yelp-ers, I would say that ther pizza is not their strong suit - its kinds greasy and not sure if they use 100% mozzarella - tastes like its cut with something cheaper. However, so far I've had:  

The Quaker (Chicken version) - Delicious. They make their chicken steaks with the chunky chicken, which I like much more than the shredded version. They could season the chicken more, but the cheese was melted perfectly and the veggies were fresh. 

The fries - crisp and flavorful. I didn't even need ketchup, and I always eat ketchup on my fries

The onion rings - a little greasy, but very tasty and crisp. The onions stayed in the breading and didn't slide out when you bit them (which I hate). 

Spanakopita - mine was a little over cooked, but the flavors were really good

Baklava - VERY GOOD! 

Signature Salad - The veggies they use are very fresh which will make or break a salad. Their balsamic is great too!

The (turkey) Greek Burger - one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had! The patty was moist and flavorful all on its own, but then they top it with what must be homemade tzatziki. I could eat a bowl of that stuff! My burger had romaine instead of the advertised arugula, but it was very fresh, so I didn't mind as much. I also asked for feta, which I didn't get, but that sauce made me forget all about it. 

Overall, this place is great! Provided they don't stray from the high quality standard they are setting, I will keep going back.

I'm giving this joint 4 stars because they have earned it, but they have the potential to be 5 stars if they work out a few kinks. Despite this, the food is truly excellent. In contrast to other Yelp reviews, their pizza is not their standout dish - it is somewhat greasy and the cheese may not be 100% mozzarella. However, the items I have tried thus far have been very enjoyable:

- The Chicken Quaker version was delicious. The chunky chicken in the chicken steaks was preferable to the shredded version, even though the chicken could use more seasoning. The cheese was melted perfectly and the veggies were fresh.
- The fries were crispy and flavorsome, not requiring the addition of ketchup (which I usually use).
- The onion rings were slightly greasy but still tasty and had a satisfying crispness, with the onions staying in place when bitten.
- The Spanakopita had slightly overcooked pastry, but the flavors were excellent.
- The Baklava was very good.
- The Signature Salad impressed me with its fresh veggies, which are crucial for a good salad. The balsamic dressing was also great.
- The Greek Burger (turkey) was one of the best turkey burgers I've ever had. The patty was moist and had great flavor, especially when paired with their seemingly homemade tzatziki sauce - which I could eat by the bowlful. Despite the burger having romaine instead of arugula as advertised, the freshness made up for it. Unfortunately, I didn't receive the feta I requested, but the flavorful sauce made me forget about it.

Overall, this place is fantastic! As long as they maintain their high quality standards, I will continue to be a repeat customer.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: A truly delightful find! This is the transformed Carrow's Restaurant on Plumb and Kietzke that was saved by the wrecking ball by its beautiful redwood beams and fascia. The food was fantastic. My wife had the tri-tip salad -- greens on one side of the plate with a balsamic vinagrette balanced by four good-sized slices of medium-rare tri-tip and potato "croutons" --
little heavenly bits of crunchy potatoes. I had the tri/tip/chicken combo, selecting the fresh corn salad and potato salad as my two sides. It was so good that we ordered dessert as well (not something I do regularly). The offering was lemon meringue, mudd pie, apple pie, and ice cream. We shared the first -- again delicious, with real, perfectly set and browned meringue. The prices were very reasonable for the quality of food and the experience. We've already recommended to family and friends locally, and expect to return soon. Well done!

The "croutons" made of crunchy potatoes were like heavenly bites. I opted for the tri-tip/chicken combo, accompanied by fresh corn salad and potato salad as sides. The flavors were nothing short of amazing, prompting us to indulge in dessert. Lemon meringue, mud pie, apple pie, and ice cream were on offer, and we shared the lemon meringue, which was pure bliss with its perfectly set and browned meringue. Moreover, the prices were reasonable considering the exceptional quality of food and overall experience. We have already recommended this place to our loved ones and intend to return soon. Well done Carrow's Restaurant, you deserve all the praise!

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Rebecca didn't Doula my birth.  BUT, she was our nanny to our first born daughter.  Over the months of her being in my home, I realized that I looked forward to talking to her before & after work.  I was big & pregnant with Baby #2, and her information & suggestions hit home with this expectant Momma!  She was always easy to talk with, yet honest and extremely truthful!  (A trait I LOVE!!!). Write a very short and concise review based on this: Stayed here three nights on business.  The property is located very close to the airport but you really don't hear it.  The rooms are standard TownePlace Suite rooms with a refrigerator, stove, etc..  The area in which the hotel is located is quiet with a combination of other hotels and office buildings.  It's about a 20 minute drive to the downtown or university area.  About 5-10 minutes from Pima Air Museum.  There are not too many restaurants close by but there are some fast food options and a sandwich place called Baggins that was really good and within walking distance.  The staff of the hotel was really friendly and helpful.  The breakfast is standard continental with a couple of hot options. They also have a reception on weekday evenings.  My only complaint is that the food and drink go quickly so get there early.  You could use this as a dinner if you wanted.  I got there about 45 minutes after it started and although there was food left there were very few soft drinks left (no diet).  They could improve by keeping the area stocked throughout the period.  Anyway, the rooms are nice, beds are comfortable and area is safe.  I would stay here again.
What would you like to say in a review based on this information?
Revise this with your best effort:
I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights on a business trip and was highly satisfied with my experience. Despite its close proximity to the airport, I was pleasantly surprised that noise was not an issue during my stay. The rooms were what you would expect from a standard TownePlace Suite, equipped with all the necessary amenities such as a refrigerator and stove.

The hotel is situated in a tranquil area amidst other hotels and office buildings. While it takes about 20 minutes to reach the downtown or university area by car, the convenience of being only 5-10 minutes away from the Pima Air Museum was a definite perk. Although the immediate vicinity lacked a wide variety of dining options, there were some fast food establishments available and I highly recommend trying the delicious sandwiches at the nearby Baggins, which is within walking distance.

The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The breakfast provided was a standard continental spread with a few hot options, and on weekdays they also hold an evening reception. However, my only critique is that the food and drink tend to deplete quickly, so it is advisable to arrive early if you plan to utilize it as a dinner alternative. Unfortunately, when I arrived 45 minutes after it started, there were very limited soft drinks remaining, with no diet options. To improve this, it would be beneficial for the hotel to maintain a consistent stock throughout the designated period.

Overall, the rooms were comfortable, the beds provided a restful sleep, and I felt safe in the area. Taking all factors into consideration, I would not hesitate to choose this hotel for future stays.

The proximity to the Pima Air Museum was also a plus. Although there weren't many nearby dining options, fast food and the highly recommended Baggins sandwich place were within walking distance. The friendly and helpful hotel staff enhanced my experience. The continental breakfast with a few hot options was satisfactory, but the food and drinks at the weekday evening reception ran out quickly. It would be beneficial if they restocked throughout the event. Overall, the comfortable rooms, pleasant staff, and safe location make me inclined to stay here again.

Write a very short and concise review based on this: We got diverted to Tampa and decided to make the drive to Orlando but first we needed somewhere to eat. Wanting to avoid chain restaurants, yelp steered us towards this little local gem!

The ladies had the 7 oz. Tampa strip and the gents both had a 14 oz. ribeye. They grill their steaks over oak and citrus Wood and the smoky flavor is to die for! We are big fans of our smoker back home and cook our steaks this way as well, it's rare to find steak cooked over woodsmoke in most places and this was worth the side trip!  Sides were veggies and sweet potatoes. The wines on offer were so reasonably priced- most under $20 a bottle but a decent selection. They just don't mark them up 5x like most places! 

Our waitress Lisa also made great recommendations and her service was welcoming, friendly, and excellent. We are so glad we went local instead of to a chain. Bookmarking this place for a return trip next time I am in Tampa for sure!
Revise this with your best effort:
We were pleasantly diverted to Tampa and decided to drive to Orlando for a meal. Yelp led us to this fantastic local find, avoiding the typical chain restaurants.

The ladies savored the 7 oz. Tampa strip while the gents indulged in the 14 oz. ribeye. The steaks were grilled over oak and citrus Wood, resulting in a delightful smoky flavor. Being fans of smoking our steaks at home, it was a rare treat to find such delicious woodsmoke-cooked steak elsewhere. The sides consisted of veggies and sweet potatoes.

To our surprise, the wine selection was reasonably priced, with most bottles under $20. The restaurant didn't mark them up at an exorbitant rate like most places do.

Our waitress Lisa provided exceptional service with warm and friendly recommendations. Going local was an excellent choice, and we will definitely be returning to this gem next time we're in Tampa.

Grilled over oak and citrus wood, the steaks had an incredible smoky flavor that was simply amazing! As enthusiasts of our own smoker back home, it's a rare treat to find steaks cooked over woodsmoke elsewhere, and this place was worth the detour! We accompanied our steaks with tasty sides of veggies and sweet potatoes. The wine selection was reasonably priced, with most bottles under $20, and surprisingly not marked up 5 times like most places!

Our waitress, Lisa, provided excellent service and made fabulous recommendations. Her warm and friendly approach made our experience even more enjoyable. Choosing a local spot over a typical chain restaurant was definitely the right decision. I highly recommend bookmarking this place for a future visit to Tampa!"

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Came here after my husband bought home their lemon pepper wings. They have plenty of flavors. Ranging from ones you've heard of (lemon pepper, mild) to New Orleans flavors (yaka mein, noonie bird). They also have their drinks. The watermelon is to die for. I don't know what they put in it but lord help them. The location isn't the best but they're trying to put something back in the community. It's in the same section with the daiquiri shop so it's really not that bad during the day. I probably wouldn't come at night by myself. Definitely give this place a try. Hey you might even see Skip.
What is your review of this restaurant?

They offer a wide range of flavors, from familiar ones like lemon pepper and mild, to unique New Orleans options like yaka mein and noonie bird. Their watermelon drink is absolutely phenomenal. I can't quite put my finger on the secret ingredient, but it's unbelievably good. The location may not be the best, but they are making an effort to contribute positively to the community. During the day, being located near a daiquiri shop actually adds to the atmosphere. However, I wouldn't recommend coming alone at night. Overall, I highly recommend giving this place a try. You might even spot Skip!

Write a very short and concise review based on this: Back to Tom Jones and time to update my review. I didn't see that odd ATM type machine that only lets you withdraw money to apply to your check. It's no longer there-used to be next to restrooms. There is still a payphone back there which I love. There are now ATM's at front entrance.
  The blue ribbon is now $3.79, but still a bargain since it includes everything: pancakes, 2 eggs, toast, sausage, bacon,juice & coffee. I ate here with my kids. My daughter's choice. Says she "loves Tom Jones". Our meals included blue ribbons, french toast, chicken, club sandwich & baked potato . Everyone gets what they like. 
   I don't smell stale smoke and would not call it dirty.  I like the "loud" orange booths. I feel like I went back in time with these and the payphone. Service is always fast and I always seem to get a different waitress. Don't know where they find these young ladies but they're good. I've seen different managers there and they are all quick and on top of things-which makes a good manager.
   Since it's my daughter's fave I'm bumping it up from 4 to 5 stars.

He treated me on the field by relocating my ankle and then told me to come to his office for treatment. I told him I could not afford that as a single mom on a teacher's salary. Instead, I saw a physician. He said it would be months before I would play again. Depressed and without much hope, I reached out to Dr. Ferrel again. He did treat me as he promised. Not only did he treat me, he healed me within weeks instead of months. Over the years Dr. Ferrel has worked on me with amazing results each time. He will always be my hero...

Write a very short and concise review based on this: I've been wanting to try Trust Me BBQ for over a year now.  I stopped in there about 3 months ago and waited in line for 10 minutes with no service and left.  After reading reviews, I figured I'd give it a chance again just to see what all the fuss is about.  The food was 50/50 but the service was horrible so I'll likely never return.  The gentleman behind the counter didn't speak, smile or engage with us at all, I felt like I was at a vending machine.  Once we finally ordered, he didn't even listen to the order and put the wrong sides in our meals, we had to correct him while he was serving.  All in all, I will just stick with Down to the Bone BBQ

Pros:  BBQ Sauce is delicious, macaroni salad was different and interesting, "pulled" pork was moist.

Cons:  Chicken was more dry than a sheet of paper, inedible even with the BBQ Sauce.  Mac & Cheese was served from a pan that has probably been on the steam table for 2-3 days.  Collard Greens were very mildly flavored.  Service was horrible.  Waited 10 minutes for no service. 

Overall:  I will not be returning to Trust Me BBQ.  The food was just not worth the frustration of dealing with the poor service.  I will stick with Down to the Bone BBQ from now on.
Revise this with your best effort: I had been eager to try Trust Me BBQ for over a year, but unfortunately, my experience left much to be desired. Three months ago, I waited in line for 10 minutes without receiving any service and decided to leave. However, after reading positive reviews, I decided to give it another chance. The food was a mixed bag, with some items being good and others falling short. However, the service was abysmal. The person behind the counter showed no interest or engagement whatsoever. Even when we finally placed our order, he got it wrong and we had to correct him while he was serving. Overall, I will not be returning to Trust Me BBQ. The delicious BBQ sauce and unique macaroni salad couldn't make up for the dry chicken, mediocre collard greens, and questionable quality of the mac & cheese. The service alone was enough to drive me away. In the future, I will stick with Down to the Bone BBQ.

Despite giving it a second chance, the food was only average and the service was terrible. The staff seemed uninterested and got my order wrong. While the BBQ sauce and macaroni salad were enjoyable, the dry chicken and stale mac & cheese were not. The collard greens were also lacking flavor. Overall, the poor service outweighed any positives, and I won't be returning to Trust Me BBQ. I'll be sticking with Down to the Bone BBQ instead.
